column1: A breath alcohol test determines how much alcohol is in your blood by measuring the amount of alcohol in the air you breathe out (exhale).
When you drink alcohol, the amount of alcohol in your blood goes up.
When the amount of alcohol in the blood reaches 0.02 to 0.03%, you may feel a relaxing "high."
Driving abilities vary among people with the same blood-alcohol levels.
The breath alcohol test helps you to know how much alcohol it takes to raise the blood-alcohol level to a dangerous level.
